text: "Jam" is a song by American singer Michael Jackson, released in 1992 as part of his eighth studio album Dangerous (1991), where it is the opening track. The song features a blend of pop and hip-hop elements, showcasing Jackson's signature vocal style and energetic performance. It includes a prominent rap verse by Heavy D (of the group Heavy D & the Boyz), which adds a unique twist to the track. The song's themes revolve around joy, celebration, and the power of music to bring people together. == Music video == The music video for "Jam" features stunning choreography and showcases Jackson's incredible dance skills. It is also known for featuring NBA legend Michael Jordan. It was directed by David Kellogg and includes various basketball scenes, emphasizing Jackson's connection to sports and performance. The song received positive reviews and is considered one of the standout tracks from the Dangerous album. == Live performances == The song was performed live by Jackson himself during the 1992-1993 Dangerous World Tour. Jackson was going to perform the song again for the This Is It concerts, but the shows were cancelled due to his sudden death in June 2009. Category:1992 songs Category:Michael Jackson songs
